page.title: 01Middleton by Youlgrave
page.content: This block consists of limestone hill country with a small village, farmsteads, dales, mines and woodland. About 150 people live within the block, but less than 50 gain a living directly from its main resources of farmland, minerals, trees, scenery and workplaces. Others travel to work far and wide, or are supported by family or state. The attractive countryside brings extra visitors. It has roads, footpaths and a picnic site. Two dales are a particularly special feature. The village has a village hall with a Public toilet, a picnic site and a playground. All other needs are met in Youlgrave, Bakewell or beyond, which can be reached by public bus or car. The block lies within the bounds of the Peak National Park.
